Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Tegan999
Reviews.Content: Recently Stayed here for work for a week. Rooms are not the best small and not worth the money. Only a lamp in the bedroom not A light in the ceiling.Restaurant needs major emprovement. Menu very plain and boring, steak come with just chips for 38$ what a joke. No normal salad on the menu that includes lettuce. this place however has a great location close to the shops and good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a little more organised...”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Saturday night after having booked the room months earlier. I'd booked the lagoon-view room through the Stamford website using the Advanced Saver rate of $165 (the normal rate for the room was quoted as $275 at the time). I arrived on the Saturday afternoon at 2.45pm, well after the check-in time of 2pm. Despite this, and despite booking the room months earlier, the receptionist informed me my room wasn't ready. She explained the hotel had been booked out the night before, thus housekeeping were a little overwhelmed. She asked if I wouldnt mind waiting for a bit, so I sat in the lobby. The receptionist was lovely, I can't emphasise that enough. Her people skills were excellent and all done with a smile. When she realised I'd been waiting for half an hour, she organised another room for me and also apologised. The room was the same type I had booked, so no problems there. It was clean and roomy and well-appointed and the bed was extremely comfortable. There were plenty of tea and coffee supplies and the water in the shower had a good, strong force. The furnishings were of an okay standard. All in all, a happy experience. This was capped off perfectly by the room service breakfast the following morning. I ordered the Stamford's version of Eggs Benedict with spinach and beautiful fresh bread. It was TO DIE FOR. Check-out was a bit slow; there was only one girl at the desk and people in front of me. I would have assumed that at 11am, the check-out deadline, there would be sufficient staff to deal with the rush. The same rule of thumb should apply to housekeeping. The Stamford is a huge hotel, so it stands to reason that there should be sufficient housekeeping staff -especially on a weekend. However, those minor quibbles aside, I enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: WandaSandhills
Reviews.Content: The hotel is obviously geared to cater for business people and conferences as the rates are equal to many of the better hotels in the Sydney CBD. The night we stayed the hotel was full and most guests appeared to be attending a conference which meant they took over the bar area and were quite noisy. Having said that, our room, which faced busy Epping Road, was remarkably quiet. The public areas such as the faux grotto near the pool and the hallways could do with a bit of tarting up, but our room was nicely furnished and clean. The beds were very comfortable but the bedding left a lot to be desired. The bottom sheets of the single beds weren't large enough to be tucked under the mattress. The top sheets were large enough to cover a king size bed. One bed had a doona and the other had a blanket folded in half and placed between the doona cover. Not really good enough when we paid $273.00 for the room (breakfast not included). The staff on the reception desk were very helpful and the restaurant food was of reasonable quality and reasonable value. The 'hot' buffet breakfast ($28.00 each) was all either cold or at best lukewarm, although the range of food on offer was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Passable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ralph15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok but has definitely seen better days and is looking pretty tired. The room was large and comfortable but not overly clean and the whole property is in need of a facelift. Reception staff were very friendly. If you have to eat in the restaurant, prepare yourself for some very average food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: nardz01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Was attending an engagement party across the road at 'The Ranch' & it was so convenient. For $160 for a sat night I thought it was a bargain! Definitely got more then what I paid for. I was the only guest who didn't stay at 'The Ranch' and i was the only one who didn't have a complaint. Quick easy check in, free parking, friendly staff & a clean nice bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Need a car though”
Reviews.Author: OS_here_we_come
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable Hotel. Gym on site is excellent.Good resort Hotel for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Hatzi82
Reviews.Content: Here on business. A comfortable stay. The room is a decent size however is not soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious although it needs a re-vamp!”
Reviews.Author: Duffy_DownUnder
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Stamford Grand North Ryde whilst on a recent 2 day trip to Sydney. The room was immaculate and very spacious. Needs a bit of work on the outside to make it look more appealing. Enjoyed overlooking the pond with the large Koi Fish. The breakfast was average, Scrambled eggs were disgusting and no pastries such as croissants available. Overall we enjoyed our stay however for the price would probably choose some where in the City next time. Transport to and from the City from North Ryde consists of about 2-3 trains.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service; Long wait for check out; Cold breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mrhi241
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night here after my sister's wedding, along with other wedding party members, family and guests. A real dampener was put on what was a fantastic evening of celebration. We arrived and had to wait for over 20 minutes to be checked-in, due to their slow computer system. We woke and headed down to breakfast at about 9am, hoping to enjoy a beautiful wedding breakfast with the bride and groom. Sadly we very disappointed with the quality of food. It was cold, tasteless and there was not much at all to choose from. Our check-out took forever! We waited 2 HOURS to check-out of 4 rooms! The mother of the groom was charged the full rate AND she had to pay for breakfast @ $28/person. The rest of us were charged a group rate that included the disgusting breakfast. There's no way I would ever pay $28. The manager was rude, he left the desk more than half a dozen times during our check-out. He made no apologies for keeping us waiting for 2 hours and continued to blame the computer system. Nothing was offered to compensate. Oh, they did offer a complimentary coffee after we were kept waiting for an 1 1/2 hours! Like we had time for their gross, cold coffee. Too bad if we had had a plane to catch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Excellent Food, Great Room & Brilliant Service!”
Reviews.Author: Christie J
Reviews.Content: I had already booked and paid for the 'seafood buffet superior room package' prior to checking Tripadvisor for the reviews. After reading other reviews I was put off the Hotel and felt terrible about booking this hotel as the last weekend I had with my partner as he was deploying with the Navy the following day, how wrong we were!!! From the minute we arrived, we were checked in by the most friendliest staff, on the way to our suite we passed 4 housekeepers who ALL went out of their way to say hello and smile at us, our suite was stunning, seperate living area, marble bench tops, huge bathroom with a great spa, huge bedroom, 2 tv's both LCD, i could go on and on! That night we had the seafood buffet in Captain Cove's restaurant, Balmain bugs, fresh oysters, prawns, so many hot dishes, desert galore, great service and a beautiful view overlooking the water! I cannot say enough positive things about our stay, what is normally a emotional time for me (when my partner deploys) was actually one of the best weekends away we have had in years. Thank you Stamford Grand North Ryde and Thank you to all your staff, we will be back! Christie J

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you are on budget”
Reviews.Author: JSeng
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because the hotel is near my company and the hotel provides free shuttle service. If you are looking for night life and more activities, then you should choose a hotel near Sydney center. The room is quite average but it's clean and comfortable. Moving from lobby to my room is quite cumbersome as there is no lift and I have to walk past the hotel restaurant on my way, with me lugging around my luggage and climbing the stairs. Stay here if you are on budget. Overall quite good value for money. And the staffs are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I stay for location, not amenities - over priced”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTrig
Reviews.Content: In 2011 I stayed her for probably 25 nights as my companies HQ is located very, very close, a 5 minutes walk away. To be honest the hotel is dated and needs some time and money invested to get it up to a decent level again, which I feel they can do because they charge like a wounded bull!!! In saying that the actual staff are very courteous and friendly, the breakfast chefs always remember me and how I like my omelette and are up for a bit of a chat. Every bathroom of every room I stayed in needs a paint job and some cosmetic repairs, but these paper mainly superficial and I have had no need to request a change of room. On 2 occasions last year I checked in late and was given a room with 2 single beds - I was NOT happy yet was unable to be moved as they were at capacity. Being at capacity happens often as large tour companies coach in for 1 or 2 nights putting a strain on staffing and amenities. To summarise this is comfortable but not grand, the group of people I travel to Sydney with for meeting are starting to look for last minute discounted accommodation in the city where we get 5 star central city accommodation for a cheaper rate.

Reviews.Title: “Passing through”
Reviews.Author: AuroraBrks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my husband, 11yr son on a Sunday night as a stop off to driving north. We booked a Deluxe Suite with a fold-away bed for our son that fitted fine in the office area of the room (note that there is a skylight in this setion of the room and my son did wake early as it was very bright in his area). On arrival we noticed the floor of our room outside the bathroom was wet, there must have been a leak from the shower from previous guests. Beds were very comfy and had a quiet nights sleep. My son loved the pool, which was the hotels best feature. However, the rest of the complex is looking very tired and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: Fredette_12
Reviews.Content: *The room we had , had a large water leak on the ceiling. The leak was brown and it smelt. I had phone the cleaners as there were all finger marks smudges all over the sliding door. Housekeeping arrived promptly but buzzed and then opened the door and entered the room!. I informed and showed housekeeping the leak. They said they wuld inform the manager. 2 hours later nothing. We went for a walk and then I went to reception and told them. They said they would contact the manager and phone me.....but nothing! I went to checkout the next dayand I refused to pay full price. After complaining I only received a $45 dollar discount for a smelly room and other peoples hairs in the bathroom! They only care about your credit card details! The reception girl was polite at checkout but said "It was probadly a toilet leaking". *Very noisy. The music from the hall very loud *Pools-Dirty, musty (smell), mouldy and there is an old CPR sign from 1992! *No foxtel. TV controls are hard to use if you want to switch channels *Needs a refurbishment. Stains on walls *If the place was refurbed, pools were clean, outside was cleaned it would be a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are good, very limited choice in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Galway_Hayes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week on business. Staff were very helpful and I was upgraded to a premium room, which was very spacious. WIFI only in the rooms, which was fine for me. As I worked late most nights, I had to rely on the hotel restuarant (there are not many restaurants in the immediate area). The menu is pretty limited.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: sleepingruby
Reviews.Content: We spent a relaxing Saturday night at the Stamford recently. Rooms are nicely decorated, spacious and well appointed and the bed was particularly comfortable. The kids enjoyed the indoor/ourtdoor pool and the seafood buffet was fresh and plentiful. We had two rooms that were at opposite ends of a very long hallway, so be prepared for bit of a hike if you're at the far end. Overall it was a very pleasant weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “This is no ordinary hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oziwarren
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Grand North Ryde is no ordinary hotel. I stayed last Saturday as it was close to a wedding we were attending. I expected a hotel room, what I got was a suite: with a large lounge and dining room area, separate bedroom and bathroom with spa bath, with an expansive balcony overlooking a tropical lagoon and water feature. The Stamford Grand is one of Sydney's hidden gems. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hobo56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on a business trip. The room was extremely comfortable and spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Close proximity to conference centre and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay ovarall”
Reviews.Author: stugs123
Reviews.Content: We purchased a hotel deal which included parking, seafoodbuffet and accomodation. I like the design of the rooms, where there is a study area and then the bedroom. Although nice, I do think the rooms is getting abit tired and could do with a bit of a face lift. Front desk staff was friendly, although some are very young and very inexperienced. The one that served me was great but I saw how another customer was treated quite rudely by the front desk staff because he was an overseas visitor and only knew a little english. The meal at the restaurant was good but again, very young inexperience staff. I think being close to the university, they must hire a lot of young inexperience staff/overseas students, so I found the service very frustrating at times. Overall a good hotel. We have been coming here for over 15 years and hate to say it, but it has gone a tad downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fx4n6
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from the airport and the kitchen staff were very happy to do a meal in the restaurant at that late hour. Beds comfy, large rooms, Very good.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jenni M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Stamford Grand North Ryde. I chose a deluxe room which had a view of the pool. The outlook was very nice from the balcony and the room very spacious, with an extra room which was home to a desk, full length mirror and counter which included the fridge and bar. This was separate from the bedroom, so there was extra space. The bed was comfortable and the linen crisp - which is always really important to me. The bathroom was marbled and in good condition. The room was clean with plenty of light. The location is great, easy access to various suburbs in Sydney as well as the airport. We had a bar lunch which was very tasty. The staff at reception were polite and concierge arranged a taxi for us for the evening, which arrived on time. Our stay was most comfortable and I would certainly return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Reception”
Reviews.Author: Coastalgal99
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for business. Before a hello, I was told"we need your credit card in case of damages". My other colleagues felt the same. Rooms are dark and dingy. Also, tv channels such as "GO" and "GEM" should be available.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely retreat at the end of the day”
Reviews.Author: SueHNSW
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Stamford Grand North Ryde. The staff were great & the service was very good. Sadly we couldn't spend time in the hotel due to family commitments in a wide range of Sydney's suburbs, but we found the location was great for our needs. We didn't eat in the restaurant as we were out morning til night, but it looked well presented and well patronised. The room was well above our expectations having a separate study as well as the generous bedroom & bathroom. Our room was well away from the "public" area of the hotel which meant we hardly had any noise from other hotel guests. We hope to return when we are less rushed & can enjoy the facilities and restaurant & bar. Only disadvantage - a "map" would be helpful to find the pool & gym due to the size of the hotel & our lack of time to explore!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding-for North Ryde!”
Reviews.Author: katandscar
Reviews.Content: I surprised my partner with a night here a while back. We chose a room that was across from the tennis courts-and it was beautiful. We even had a full marble bathroom which we were very impressed with! We enjoyed a very romantic night in and had dinner in the restaurant. It was a seafood buffet night which wasn't great, but we loved the bar and outdoor area. We loved the stay and would thoroughly recommend! It was pristine, private, and very close to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “It's the small things that make a difference...”
Reviews.Author: woolygirl1
Reviews.Content: It's the small things that make a difference.... and the Stamford Grand North Ryde lacks these. Overall, the accommodation was of an average quality - not poor, but not outstanding. The small things that disappointed me: 1) The quality of the bedding was very poor. Sheets were rough and scratchy. Pillows were flat and lumpy. The bottom sheet on the bed did not even tuck in properly (ie: too small) 2) The shower had used toiletry bottles in it - poor attention to detail in cleaning. No body lotion available. Towels were small and again, rough and scratchy. 3) No cold drinking water other than for purchase from mini-bar available, and to get a bucket of ice from the bar cost extra. 4) Long delay on checking out due to problems with computer system - seriously, it took over 15 minutes to check out. Also, lots of noise in the roadside room - traffic noise, noise from patrons at the Ranch bar across the road, and also aircraft noise overhead. Asking for a pool view room might alleviate this. I would return for business, but not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graham C
Reviews.Content: Having booked 6 rooms for a recent wedding celebration for my daughter we were all delighted, not only with the Hotel itself but also the friendless and efficiency of all the staff from front desk to housekeeping. I would definitely recommend the Stanford to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better for a "Grand" hotel”
Reviews.Author: skress
Reviews.Content: I stay here 2-3 times per month as it is around the corner from our office. Compared to other "Stamford Grand Hotels", this one is really below par. The staff are great and the restaurant serves good food, but the facilities are not up to the standard of a others. The layout normally requires a 10 minute walk to you room down a corridor that seems about 1km long... It is located right on a busy corner. The "Ranch Hotel" across the street hosts young kids on Thursday nights which is noisy if your room is on the Epping Rd side. OK for a lower grade hotel, but not what you'd expect from a Stamford Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KennethJacobs
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here in July this year for our anniversary. Always a very relaxing and resort like place to stay with it's tropical and expansive gardens, beautiful swimming pools, tennis court and gymnasium. The restaurants offer great meals. Plenty of carparking is available. A good location for quick access to the city centre via the freeway. One of the better hotels in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “So clean and airy, a great place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: After travelling and staying at different places it was a relief to stay in the Stamford. It was clean, comfortable, and has reasonable spacious rooms. The breakfast staff were extra helpful in catering for special diets. I've read reviews before of hotels only to be very disappointed when I got there, but the Stamford is on my return list.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: MPCLDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stamford Grand hotel for one night while attending a business conference. The hotel is clean and staff is friendly. The hotel lobby, rooms, conference area, grounds is nothing special. The pond was overgrown and not well maintained. The rooms were not warm nor inviting. The location is not convenient for walking to shopping or attractions, however a large Mall is a 5 mintue drive. If I need to attend another conference again at the hotel, I would choose to stay, however for any other travel to Sydney, I would choose to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Could probably find better for cheaper”
Reviews.Author: jello1984
Reviews.Content: My work sends me to North Ryde every 6 months for work, so they put me up at the Stamford as it is walking distance to the office. The hotel itself is ritzy and grand, with high ceilings and a huge garden. The rooms are tidy and functional, roomy enough (except for one I stayed in that had the toilet wedged between the shower recess and the wall). Rooms have wifi and broadband and wifi, at a (high) price. Check in and check out has never been simple when charging to the company, despite me having all the chargeback info, and usually ends with me charging to my credit card to save time. Reception staff are otherwise friendly and helpful. Breakfast is terrible, I've tried the eggs cooked every way offered, all of which were watery and barely edible. Juice tasted like cordial, mushrooms probably came from a can, and butter and condiments come those cheap sachets that you would get free in any cheap hotel. Hardly worth $34. Restaurant is small portions of 3 star food at a 5 star price. Stamford is adequate for business and need a bed (if the boss is paying) but there are plenty of better, cheaper options if you were on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Room for some improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Pugadonis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stamford North Ryde for several days in May 2011. My overall impression is one of a well run hotel but there are some issues that should be addressed. Firstly, like so many hotels, the cost of internet access is ridiculous and the cable TV channels are limited. The room service was generally good although one meal ordered had been microwaved and was still very cold inside (but the accompanying roti was excellent. Any hallway traffic and voices could be heard from within my room, partly due to a large gap between the bottom of the door and the floor. I did complete the customer satisfaction survey but have not had any response from the management regarding my suggestions. Given this is not an expensive hotel, my overall rating would be 7/10.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: WebaWeka
Reviews.Content: The Weka stayed here for one night only between Regis on Castlereagh and Hughenden stays. After getting out of Regis, it was nice to make our way to Stamford Grand for we certainly deserved, after that shamozzle) a nice clean room. The room, okay, a little dated, was clean. The sleep was great. We made our way down to dinner (all you can eat smorgasboard), which was a little expensive. But overall I can not fault this place. We had a really pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for my business travel needs”
Reviews.Author: DaHoneymoonerz
Reviews.Content: Great location & premier room was fantastic, has all my standard business requirements like fast checkout and buffet breakfast , the courtesy bus to the local business parks is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Room good but no wifi”
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference. The hotel is about $80 taxi fare from the airport. You can get the train and 10 min walk. The room was nice and the bed was big and comfy. I couldn't believe for the price and standard of the room there was no wifi. There was Internet connection through plugging in to the wall but that was no good for an iPad. I had some bar food which was pretty tasty actually. Breakfast was a good spread.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet a nice stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Sydney2for2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on the weekend of 23-24 July 11. The front desk was very helpful and friendly, completing the check-in process quickly and efficiently. We were in 2026, a lovely suite. The room was clean and modern with a large king size bed. Unfortunately, the bed was very hard but not overly so, although we both woke up a bit stiff. The bathroom was also clean and modern although a bit tight - the toilet is jammed between the shower and sink. The towels were fresh and not threadbare, as we have found in other motels. The room airconditioner wasnâ€™t very good - although we had it set on the highest temperature setting, the room never really warmed up. Also, itâ€™s noisy, so we didnâ€™t run it at night when we went to bed. As the balcony door had no flyscreen or windows for that matter, there is no option to leave a door open for some fresh air. We ate out that night but had the breakfast in the Captain Cook's Cove Restaurant (we took the Snuggle package and got breakfast for only $1 each) Breakfast was the usual fare - cereals, eggs, bacon etc - but was of a very good quality, although donâ€™t bother with the 'pop cakes'. They are tiny and are really more like pikelets. The scrambled eggs on the other hand were great. As a couple of other reviewers have noted, the hotel is looking a bit tired. After breakfast we went for a walk by the pool - there are a number of cracked/missing tiles on the outside stairways, moss growing in gaps in other tiles and concrete, and on a number of balconies, dark staining from drain pipes. Whilst the room was nice, the overall look of the hotel needs a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “As always a pleasure to visit”
Reviews.Author: Donz64
Reviews.Content: 3rd time here - Twin share top floor overlooking fish ponds - Reception happy friendly and caring - Seafood buffet divine hearty breakfast included with so much to choose from! clean tidy rooms as always well done Stamford Grand North Ryde - I dont bother looking elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Shelden60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stamford Grand North Ryde June 2011 - 3 day package $125.00 per night including buffet breakfast and car parking. Excellent value, the room was clean and quiet, buffet breakfast had a wide selection. Great fitness centre. Staff all very polite and courteous. Great location - found it easy access from the airport (with car), close to shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “grand!”
Reviews.Author: jum253
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my partner. This hotel has exceptional quality in service. The staff were very friendly and professional. You MUST dine in their restaurant! The first night my partner and I had the seafood buffet, yes it does cost $65, but the quality of food was of the highest standard (and plus, it would work out cheaper than having a 3 course a la carte). Dessert selection was to die for. Cheese platters. Seafood: mussels, oysters, smoked salmon, crab, octopus, prawns...! The quality of the lamb, beef and pork cuisines were amazing. If you dine here, try to have an early dinner (6 â€“ 6:30), there are less people dining and walking around the buffet area, and the dishes are well presented and untouched. The next day, buffet breakfast: the best scrambled eggs I have had in a hotel! Bircher museli was made deliciously as well, nice and sweet, other hotels make it quite bland. The hotel has a lovely lagoon and pool, where my partner and I went for a stroll after breakfast. I assumed that since other reviewerâ€™s implied that this hotel is losing its elegant touch, that the pond would be infested with algae and lifeless. I was pleased to watch many koi fish become excited by our presence by swarming under our feet by the board walk, probably hoping that we would feed them! Laying by the pool side and soaking up the rising morning sun was bliss! We headed out to Macquarie Centre, which is literally around the corner, went for some retail therapy, and watched a movie, then drove back â€œhomeâ€�; it was totally stress-free! We ordered room service for lunch, fast and friendly service, the Stamford burger was very tasty and meaty and the cannelloni was very nice as well. At night we chose the a la carte menu. Cause we werenâ€™t overly hungry, we skipped the entrees, and went straight for mains. My partnerâ€™s lamb was cooked to perfection! And my duck was to die for, with the meat falling off the bone! For dessert, my partnerâ€™s crÃ¨me brulee was light textured and subtly sweet, and my chocolate implosion was a decadent chocolate overdose (thatâ€™s if you enjoy dark chocolate). Breakfast the next morning was just as perfect. Upon reading the other reviews, I was slightly reluctant to stay here but gave it a go anyways. I can see what the other reviews meant by the hotel needs a coat of paint, it didn't really bother me. The bathroom was pretty small, and the toilet was crammed between the basin and the shower, which did feel like an aeroplane cubicle. However, our superior suite had a spa bath, which I wasnâ€™t aware of upon booking, which was a bonus! The hairdryer provided was amazingly powerful (sunbeam ionic hairdryer), not many hotels provide good hairdryers! The room was clean and spacious, i thought the decor was nothing of extraordinary or elegant, but it was comfortable. Bed was not as plush as I was hoping for from Stamford, and it wouldâ€™ve been nice to have complimentary bath robes and slippers, especially since this is a resort style hotel. My partner had no complaints at all, maybe thats cause he is a guy. There were asian tourists staying at the hotel on the second night (i can say this and not sound racist cause i am asian as well lol), but they were making so much noise on the hallways and outside my room at night, i had to tell them to be quiet. Also, my room faced epping rd, and the ranch hotel guests were making some infrequent noise aswell, but it didnt really affect my quality of sleep, but i guess i cant give fault to the hotel for this, maybe next time i stay i would get the deluxe suite that faces the pool/lagoon. We had booked on wotif, so we had a fairly good room discount and drink vouchers! Overall, a wonderful and relaxing stay. I would definitely come back... esp for the food!

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the attitude - probably used to be a nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rosskel
Reviews.Content: We booked our two-night stay at the Stamford through an external website. Apparently the website we used does not 'speak' to the Stamford website, so although we had been charged for the room, Stamford had not been paid. This caused a great deal of confusion on check-in, but after a while we sorted it out and were told that our breakfasts would be complimentary as a gesture of goodwill. Upon checkout the hotel attempted to charge us the full price for the breakfasts because we had used room service instead of the dining room. I replied that this distinction had not been made. The attitude I encountered from the manager was startling; he agreed to waive the charge, but insisted that "Everyone coming into the hotel knows that breakfast is in the dining room"...implying that I was either naive or an idiot. You don't get that kind of attitude from good hotels which deserve their star rating because they understand that the important thing is customer service. The Stamford's manager seem to think the important thing is to be right. So, stressful check-in AND stressful check-out. Was the actual hotel any good? Once you get past the faded opulence of the foyer, there's no more opulence and plenty of 'faded'. Our room - optimistically referred to by the desk clerk as a 'suite' - was tucked-away at the furthest reaches of the hotel. We were travelling with our 18-month old son and had to carry the pram over three sets of stairs to reach the room. There was a lift, but it was at the opposite end of the hotel, so that wasn't any quicker. When we got to the room it reeked of cigarette smoke. On the Saturday night we could not sleep because of the noise of the hotel staff; our room was above the alley where the kitchen staff stand, smoking and talking. Loudly. There was also noise from the other rooms; we could hear people talking. The one good thing I can say about the place is that the food was excellent. Some of the best gnocchi I've ever had still couldn't make-up for the disappointment of the experience. I might have been happy if it were a three star hotel, but the place is so run-down. Another reviewer said it could do with a lick of paint. I think that's a serious understatement. I imagine it was a very nice place twenty years ago, but not anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, dirty, charmless, noisy- 10pm check in so it's too late to leave and find somewhere else - pity”
Reviews.Author: wickywackywoowaa
Reviews.Content: Our office moved to North Ryder. First to rib this hotel. I was allocated room 2002. It's practically in the bar - I can reach over my balcony into the beer garden. The crappy music went on until past 10pm and the noise from guests much longer. The bathroom had a used bar of soap with hair on it- along with hairs on the bed. The room smelt of mould and had frayed carpet. It is such an unpleasant place to stay. If you can find an alternative - save your money and go there.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were being waited on - wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: CFCamden
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed for one night in an Executive Suite in the Premier Wing. We arrived at 10.30am as we had just checked out of another hotel nearby. I called on our way asking if there was anyway we could check in earlier and was told as the hotel was fully booked the night before, it was unlikely any rooms were ready but we were welcome to drop our bags off and come back when it was ready. Upon arrival we were told that a room was ready now and were welcome to take it, which was fantastic news and I appreciated the staff member checking this. The room was overwhelmingly lovely, comfortable and plush. The Kings size bed had clean, beautiful linen and the marble bathroom was spotless and stocked with L'Occitane bathroom products. We had a private courtyard which was great. The TV was set to a tiny volume and our kettle didnt work but when we called reception, they sent someone within 2 minutes, such great service and we felt as though they catered to every request. I went to go and have a dip in the pool in the late afternoon and i was almost alone apart from a young family but chose to return to my room when I looked up at one of the top floor balconies and saw a very hairy man completely naked pashing his female companion clad in only a t-shirt - quite a sight but obviously not the hotel's fault! The hotel was beautiful and really great service. We passed on the seafood buffet because of the $65 price tag, but that's not uncommon for a 5 star hotel. Loved our stay here, if only it was longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to staying City”
Reviews.Author: LizzyLeeton
Reviews.Content: We stay here a fair bit as it is easy to get to when we visit from the Country. The service once again was outstanding and the room excellent. We always book from Wotif and there is often a huge price difference on rooms from day to day. We saved $80 by delaying a booking by a day! The hotel has a great atmosphere and the only down side is the distance to the city and airport but, if you are like us and had no business to do in town then it is great. Recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, we loved the staff all were very friendly & helpful, the room was clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Susiewrx
Reviews.Content: This motel was close to the venue and the staff were wonderful. We did have a problem with service for the mobile in the bar area but was really of no Consequence so no big deal. The staff was obliging and we had a wonderful night. It was very quiet & our balcony overlooked the lagoon. Beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun090
Reviews.Content: Excellent check in. Very clean Motel, Pool was great. Rates were excellent at $ 140.00 per night. Best pillows ever. Location was very good. Would definately go back..

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with young kids”
Reviews.Author: shell_morgan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times. With young kids, the rooms are a great size as you can have roll aways put in and there is still plenty of room to move around. I like the fact that the rollaways are placed in the 'study area' of the room and then the main bed is separated at the other end of the room. Most rooms have balconies. There are tea/coffee facilities and mini bar. The bathroom amenities are good, everything that you need. The rooms are starting to look a little tired and will soon be due for a make over. The beds are comfy, if you have a room on the side of the hotel that faces the main road, you can experience some traffic noise. I would suggest you request a room away from the main road. The pool is great and there is plenty of room. Gym offered is average. Car parking is free, bt not overly secure. For a one night stop over, this is a great hotel if you don't want to go and stay in the city. Central to the freeway to the north coast, M4, M7 and M5. On a good run, it will take you 15-20 mins to get into the city by car.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: SATCSydneyGirl
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect from the Stamford Grand after reading mixed reviews and ratings on Trip Advisor. It was the best local choice for us at the time though so we went with it, spending 9 nights there over Xmas Dec 2010. Very pleasantly suprised - housekeeping staff were excellent. Christmas dinner buffett was great value and staff accomodated us as a fairly late booking. In room dining menu options needed to include more mid priced options, with a $3 surcharge applied to all meals, not just breakfast and beverages as the menu states. Food otherwise was expensive for what you got, and not a lot of healthy options. Pool fittings look tired and only one broken sun umbrella around it. Saying that, fitness centre facilites were very good. The green option (save $10 off hotel bill for each day you don't get your room cleaned) was excellent for longer stays - just make sure you keep a record as reception staff don't always despite ringing through to them each time we wanted it. Room decor was nice and spacious. Overall we enjoyed our stay, though, and found it a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and decent sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: JTG98
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 2 year old. We got a great rate on lastminute, which included breakfast. Rooms were large and well appointed with a separate study which we used for the rollout bed. The bathrooms are a bit tired as was the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Sabreman_08
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my parents for 2 nights at this hotel. We arrived at the hotel late on Friday night, absolutely worn out. I would expect check-in should take maximum 15 mins so I came in to do the check-in with my Dad while our fiend (who was driving us) plus my Mom and my baby waiting outside in the car. However, check-in turned out to be almost an hour with me running around like a headless chook. After having no luck with finding our names on the hotel booking system, we were asked to provide our booking confirmation, which was fine, and given a key to the room. Upon arriving at the room, we managed to turn on the lights in the bathroom but not in the main bedroom (there was a switch on the wall which I assumed to be light switch as in many other normal hotels I have been to). Gave a call to reception (and it was picked up by the very person that checked us in) to tell him about our problem. He explained that we should turn on the switch near the bed, not the one on the wall???? The room was absolutely dark so after 5 mins trying to switch on everything that I could reach, I gave up and called reception again. I suspected that he recognized my room number and thought I was a trouble-marker (???) so he didn't bother to pick up the phone. I rang twice (and left it ringing for a long while) but no one picked up!!!!! Had to make my way to reception again, the front desk again tried to explain to me where the switch should be and what I should do blah blah blah before I lost my temper and told him that I could not see a thing in the dark! At last, he asked someone to go and fix the lights. This gentleman was nice talking to, explained to me that the light on the wall was for nothing (!!!), and he showed me how to turn on the tall lamp near the bed , but he himself failed to turn on the 2 side lamps. He then told me that he would get that fixed as soon as possible. And that was never been fixed or replaced as I heard from my Dad. What a terrible service! You called yourself 4.5 stars, please at least check if everything in the room functions the way it should be. And in case you forgot to do so, please show some respect to customers by listening to them and fixing what you promised to fix (your problem, not ours)! I will only stay in this hotel if I'm really desperate. However, I'd rather stay in a smaller hotel with smaller room, further to our place but has staffs who care.

Reviews.Title: “Nice layout , good service”
Reviews.Author: DaHoneymoonerz
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms resort feeling lovely pool . Service was great and breakfast was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably comfortable stay, with an excellent buffet breakfast though expensive $60 buffet dinner spread.”
Reviews.Author: almondblossom
Reviews.Content: I would have stayed for dinner but it was too pricey, $60 for a buffet was out of my price range. Nice and cheaper dinner across the road at the local Hotel for half the price, including a drink. My room was facing the main road and was noisy, hot, stuffy and smelt sort of musty. Opening the door and airing the room seemed to fixed the problem. Nice pool setting, fish pond and greenery in an enclosed area where it was nice to sit and have an early morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our Second Anniversary Weekend and left us stranded....”
Reviews.Author: jo2325
Reviews.Content: I would like to start with I had been planning our weekend for months and after deciding to stay at the Stamford tryed to pay for our room off there website str8 away.. ....Well they dont do that they want you to fax them your details ....Anyways I dont have a fax so thought will just pay on the day...I booked a month in advance to the date we were staying....... We drove to Sydney excited about our weekend we were about to enjoy.....Well we get to the hotel only to be told that you have to use a credit card ...Well we dont have a credit card ( we have a debit card ) and all our money was on us personally ...Well they wanted 200 security deposit and there was no way they would accomadate us So after dragging my husband out of there we ended up driving around and around Sydney only to find a little motel that took cash and had spiders in there bed...Will not name this motel as the guy was gr8 and it wasnt his fault all this stuff happened before we got our room.... to cut a long story short our anniversary weekend just went from bad to worse and I blame it all on Stamford Grand for not telling me before I arrived that I couldnt just pay for my room there was hidden costs...I was a cleaner not so long ago in the Hunter Valley and I know what people do to rooms but I would not ever trash or even leave our room dirty.....The guy behind the desk too All i can say is a complete tool with no feelings watsoever And I didnt get his name but he had scruffy hair and glasses and I hope no-one ever has to go through what we did this past weekend....If you want to stay in a gr8 motel go to the Mantra......

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ1955
Reviews.Content: My partner and I live local to ryde and had to stay at the Stamford for two nights while we were rennovating our home. We had eaten in the restaurant many times in the past but had never actually stayed in the hotel. The hotel itself is fairly unique- resort style but in a business park. The rooms are adequate and the decor of the hotel is reasonable. The one thing that sets this hotel in North Ryde apart from its competitors is the staff and service. We were politely greeted by a young man named Michael at check in, and he was just very nice. He was such a respectful young man and made us feel so welcome. We ate breakfast in the restaurant both mornings (which was a great buffet with so many options- a little too many when you are on a diet) and both times we were greeted by a young girl named Maria- she had to be one of the nicest people we have ever come across in customer service. She individually said hello and good morning to every single customer with lovely smile on her face. She was absolutely wonderful! She was also there at lunch time on our second day and served us a very impressive seafood pie. She looked after us as if we were VIP's! In fact all of the staff in the restaurant were excellent. Even the housekeepers were nice- we some how managed to get lost in the hotel and a lady named Mary helped us find our way back to the hotel entrance. We did unfortunately experience some bad service from a lady named Renee at the front desk, she was very unhelpful and did not smile at all. This was not a major problem but her bad service did stand out due to the rest of the staff being so great. Besides the one staff member not being very friendly, I have to rate this hotel highly. It is rare that you find service in an establishment to be almost 100% consistent so this is why I would suggest the Stamford Grand hotel to friends and family- the staff there really do make you feel like you are at home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JanineL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stamford 3 times now and each visit has been quiet good. The weekend rates make it a suitable location when visiting Sydney as friends and family are near-by. I have had a couple of issues when checking in (misreading of my room request, etc) but on each occassion the problem was fixed very quickly by the staff. I was charged after I left for items in the mini bar which I did not use but again this was fixed very quickly after I telephoned them. Staff at the breakfast restaurant need further training, it is not correct servcie to remove the plate of one customer when their partner is still eating. On my last visit I ordered a room service dinner. The meal was a little late but was very good. The rooms are ok but the bathrooms are starting to look very tired. The common areas and hallways also need some updating. Location wise it is very close to Macquarie and Top Ryde shopping centres and the new train line into the city is very handy. I will stay there again as long as they keep their cheap weekend rates.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously needs attention”
Reviews.Author: TwoSixFiveOh
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs serious management attention. When we checked in, we were told our room card could open the security garage door. No, it didn't. When we finally got in (after another trip to the front office), the basement lift did not work. We pushed the attention button and it took 10 minutes before someone answered it - and said - someone has been sent down. Another 15 minutes later, only did someone showed up to say - oh, lift does not work. Wonderful. Long walk around. Beware this hotel is very spread out so if you have stuff to carry, you better drop it off and get the concierge to move it to your room. I don't know how long that will take though. Housekeeping on the next day did not change the towels which we had put on the floor. That meant it needed changing. But no, despite the dirt, it was just folded up neatly as if it was new. Absolutely shocking. For helping with a survey, they give you a $10 voucher for your next stay. Next time, keep the $10 discount and give me fresh towels after wiping up all the sweat from the walk to the room. Also Internet access is $12.95 per hour or $24.95 for 24 hours. I hope I have my own personal T3 line for that price.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, not bad not good.”
Reviews.Author: Jodie_Gonz
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband are from America and stayed at this hotel as it is near where we wanted to travel and do thing whilst on holidays for a few weeks, we are stopping by Cairns for a week on the way back home. Check-in was ok, counter staff were reasonably efficient in getting us checked in to our upgraded room which was a pretty good touch. It was very clean, we got lost going to our room a bit due to looking at things and taking a wrong turn, but got back on track pretty quickly. The pool is great, resembles tropical environment. The restaurant is great, modern and clean, highly recommended. All up not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tery
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 teenagers and 1 other child. Staff at reception were very helpful and friendly, I dealt with Michael mostly and he was extremely efficient, friendly and helpful. The hotel is like a tropical resort in the middle of suburbia, and although the weather wasn't great the teenagers loved the pool and the gym. The rooms were much better than I remembered them from a previous visit some years ago, nicely and comfortably furnished, quiet and very well presented. We only had one glitch, we couldn't get the in house movies to work, so we couldn't put all the kids in one room to be entertained while we had a relaxing drink in the other room :-( We ate at the restaurant Saturday night and had the new seafood buffet. It was excellent, good choice of bugs, crabs, prawns and fish etc constantly replenished..fresh and much better than i expected. The price for the kids @ $20 a head was good value, and they actually ate a good meal which is no small feat considering they are teenage girls !!! They loved the desserts as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprising. Excellent Value. Spacious Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: fealyr
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Stamford Grand North Ryde as it was close to a relatives home who we were visiting for a family event, so the location suited us. We booked via an e-mail promotion direct from the Stamford group and got an excellent price. I'd stayed at at the old Stamford Grand in Double Bay before and really liked it so was confident that North Ryde would be of a similar standard. We checked in late after a long day and the process was very swift. Our booking had been for a superior suite but upon check-in we were upgraded to an Executive Suite which was a welcome surprise. We were directed where to park (in a secure basement) and how to find our room. The hotel is set on a sloping block and is long and low and the corridor is kind of split level, so originally we walked into the wrong floor but it didn't take long for us to orient ourselves and we found that our room was actually very convenient to get to from the car. The Executive wing was a secure wing and our room (1065) was well equipped with a large marble bathroom with corner spa, a kitchenette, and King-size bed. The decor was tasteful and cosy, and there was plenty of floorspace to set up our baby's portacot (we brought our own). The room had a small private terrace with 2 chairs and a table. The toiletries were L'Occitaine (Verbena scented) and the rooms were very clean and obviously well-maintained. I used the iron and hairdryer (which honestly was the best hairdryer I've ever used - a Sunbeam Ionic 2000 - I gotta get me one!). Everything just worked. No problems. Check-out was also straight forward. The resort-style grounds around the pool etc looked great (fish ponds, boardwalks etc). Shame we weren't there longer to make use of the facilities on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again management are Nazi's to their staff!”
Reviews.Author: Compuware94560
Reviews.Content: I work for Compuware and I stayed at this property in early July, our room was prepared very nicely but the room service staff and the room service staff were very bubbly. As I was leaving my room down to catch a cab I hear a Asian lady yelling at her room service staff down the corridor, this poor girl from what I could see was very distressed and in tears. This Asian lady had her arms flying everywhere, towing over this lady to show her superiority. This poor room attendant was treated like a slave not an employee. I didnâ€™t think much of it but was very distressing to see of how the managerial staff treat their employees at this hotel. No matter what someone has done there is a humane way of talking to someone definitely no people skills here!!! After a long day and night I was woken up by the same lady screaming at another room attendant at bloody 10am this time It was my room next door, I was clearly shaken by this and this put me off my entire morning. As I was walking out I managed to have a word with the room attendant who had red eyes. I took down her name â€“ Annie Tang Manager of the department. STAY WAY from this hotel as itâ€™s run by Naziâ€™s who donâ€™t give a rats about their staff, the value and comfort of their guests or the reputation of their hotel. Iâ€™ll be staying at the hotel across the road from now on as they treat this staff humanely and an overall more enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer satisfaction obviously not a priority at Stamford Grand”
Reviews.Author: CranberryBabe
Reviews.Content: We're staying 6 nights at this hotel, and so far nothing has gone right: Day 1 â€“ Check-in No bell service in sight from moment taxi arrive at hotel to check-in completion, so we lugged our luggage on our own to the room only to find the Do Not Disturb sign lighted up. Obviously key didn't work on the door, so I had to wait outside the room with our bags while my husband walked back to the lobby to sort this out. After 20 minutes of sitting outside the corridoor, husband came back with new keys to another room, so we had to lug our luggage to the other room. After unpacking, discovered that internet is not working. Took the entire night and numerous reminder calls to front desk and Docomo and missed dinner, still couldn't get the internet working. Staff and ISP kept insisting it's our notebook settings, we reminded them we had 2 notebooks and both not working. Besides, we had just moved from the Marriott at Circular Quay and didn't have any problems. Anyway, they promised that by 10am the next day it would be up and running... Day 2 Woken up by drilling sounds from restaurant renovation downstairs and tough luck, internet service still not working. Hotel engineers came and went, calls to Docomo, we finally gave up and went out while they said they would sort out the problem. We were extremely upset after the messed-up check-in and internet problems, asked front desk to have Paul Gallop call us since he seemed very interested for guests to feedback. After our return in the evening, we enquired about the internet issue at front desk, they were clueless about the status and asked us to check on our own in the room. So we suspected that no one actually did anything about the problem. Checked again, didn't work. Went to front desk to get the key to another room and brought my laptop to test in the other room. Bingo! Works afterall... guess everyone was wrong when they were so sure that it was our internet settings and not their internet service. So unfortunately, had to pack up again and change rooms since we're here on a business trip so internet is crucial... but fortunately because now we didn't have to call Housekeeping since they have convieniently decided that we didn't need replenished shower gel, shampoo and conditioner when they cleaned the room. Was exhausted by the time we unpacked (again) in the new room, and before we retired for the evening, we realized that the General Manager never called. Day 3 Relived that we finally have internet service, but discovered in the morning that the room safe is not working! Before leaving the hotel for the day, informed the front desk of faulty room safe and please have it fixed. I mean, what else can go wrong in one single stay? Similar to all the inconveniences imposed upon us, staff was not sympathetic and appears indifferent. Or maybe they have just grown immune to guest complaints? Returned to hotel in the evening, room safe still not working. And guess what? They didn't clean up our room too! Also bumped into a friend staying at the same hotel this evening, appeared that when she checked-in she was also allocated an occupied room and had to return to the front desk to get another room. So every night I had to make sure that I bolt the door with the coffee table, since I am not sure if the electronic double locking system actually works and front desk might just decide to give my room keys to a new guest? Also, no call from Paul so far. I suppose he is just not interested in our problems at his hotel. Unfortunately my husband feels bad about moving to the Marriott Courtyard since people at work had made the booking for him, so now I just wonder what else can possibly got wrong for the next 4 nights? Now I just look forward to going home this weekend. Others things I dislike: - Small/cramped bathroom - Tiny shoebox shower stall with a tiny soap tray so there's no where to place toiltries - Shower has no water pressure, takes me double the time to shower (very frustrating!) - Hotel staff's negative attitude to guest's problems caused by faulty or inefficient service (full of excuses with no attempt to fix the problem and require constant reminders to them that the problem is still not fixed - I think maybe they are hoping people will simply give up and go away) - Very limited TV channels, and some channels not working or available like CNN, Music channel - Traffic noise if you stay in the rooms facing the road (they gave us this room despite us telling them we'd like a quiet room) What I like: - Proximity to mall and rail station

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend escape from the city”
Reviews.Author: TDeson
Reviews.Content: Needed a break for the long weekend, but I couldn't go too far, so took my partner here. Found a great rate on the Hotel's website on Friday and checked in Saturday. Staff on check in very friendly (and smiling! unlike other hotels I've stayed recently). The Hotel is only two levels, so it is long an low, but the carpark extends the length, so we checked in and drove down closer to our room. (Valet parking option was offered). We had been upgraded to an "Executive" suite, which was great as it had a corner spa. Our room was down the end of the complex, so we had a little view over the tennis court and could see down to the pool and health club. Being winter it was a bit cold to try the pool - next time maybe. We had a lovely afternoon/high tea in the restaurant/bar there. We could have sat outside, but it was a bit cold, so we stayed inside and enjoyed the view through the HUGE windows that overlook the gardens here. (There is also a little Koi pond in the gardens - saw some kids having fun feeding the fish). Decided not to stay for the seafood buffet (but it looked good as it was being set up). Apparently they are about to do a major refurb of the restaurant & kitchen. Hope they keep the big windows. Went back to the room, enjoyed a looong spa and jumped on the comfy king bed. Bliss. We were still full from the afternoon tea, so only order a little room service for dinner. Food very good, quickly brought and tasty. Service guy called me "sir" - haven't been called that in a while. Settled in to sleep on the comfy king bed. Room very quiet so slept in Sunday (ask for late check out - worth it!). Best Room Service Eggs Benedict we have ever had for breakfast (needed a little garnish on the plate tho). Drove back down to reception to check out. Again with the smiley staff. Concierge offered to help with directions too - nice touch. I look forward to coming back in summer to see what they did with their new restaurant - and to enjoy the fab pool!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Luxury Romantic Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Exotic_01
Reviews.Content: I needed a short break but was unable to get out of Sydney. I highly recommend this hotel for a getaway as it is a Tranquil Luxury Romantic Oasis. There is an outdoor spa and swimming pool which leads into an indoor heated swimming pool. There is a restaurant overlooking a romantic lagoon with waterfalls creating a resort style atmosphere. I stayed in an Executive Spa Suite located in the Premier Wing, which was pure luxury. It had a large corner spa in the bathroom with the softest bathrobes, and the most comfortable king size bed. The staff were very friendly from the second we checked in and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but lacks polish with service”
Reviews.Author: csturzaker
Reviews.Content: My Partner and i booked the romance and seduction package, we stayed 2 nights, we liked everything overall but lacked polish from the staff the little things that count. We liked the room, thought the spa bath was great, the bed was really comfy and the room was good. i didnt understand how they had a huge tv unit but a small 51cm tv in it? One of the telephones didnt work dialling but the hotel could ring the room on it. The other phone worked so i wasnt too concerned. When we arrived to our hotel room, it was so nice part of our package was that when we arrived there would be rose petals on the bed and floor and some wine and some little hordorves and some choc dipped strawberrries, this was really nice! and the wine was a moe' which was nice!!! The food was absolutely delish, we didnt eat from the restaurant we ordered in to our room, it was 40 mins late for the dinner but it was nice food, breakfast for the first night was half hour late but was worth it. Breakfast for the 2nd night was on time and really good. The only thing i wasnt happy with was part of our package was to have our spa bath run and have candles lit around the bath, i had organised times an confirmed twice and both nights of the packge this did not happen, we made sure we confirmed with the staff they assured that this would be done but it didnt, it seems no one knew bout the package or what was going on, when i had told the staff on the 2nd day of the stay about it they just looked at me confused and dismissed it, the check out i did mention it again that we were forgotten the person who checked me out was very appologetic about it but that was it. We were sposed to get a late check out but when i confirmed on check in we were told 12, when we checked out at 12 on the monday the manager had told me i should of got a later checkout, we were little disappointed that we werent told the correct information . So overall we enjoyed our stay and it was very relaxing, i loved the chinese gardens and if it wasnt winter we would def used the pool and spas. It just lacked the finishing touches and the staff didnt seem to know what was going on or knowledge of the packages .everyone was polite and greeted us everywhere we went in the hotel which was nice even the room cleaners throughout the hotel. We would come back again but we are a little hesistant if we do if we would be forgotten? we were also sort of testing out the hotel for a wedding venue and reception, but we in doubt as we arent sure if we will forgotten or the little details would not be done/.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and terrible food!”
Reviews.Author: designfanatic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite large with a large courtyard area with pool and fountains and tennis court. Unfortunately it is quite outdated and does not appear to have proper upkeep. The rooms are average and in need of refurbishment. We stayed in an excutive suite with spa tub. The bath products are average and the size of the soaps is actually quite funny. They are so tiny that you are best to bring your own. I ventured down to the lobby in search of a gift shop to buy some regular soap, but to my surprise they actually don't have a gift shop they have across from the front desk a glass case of a few odds and ends to purchase but you have to ask front desk for help and then they have to check for stock of which there was none. This exercise took about an hour. The bed was reasonable. The wing in which we stayed was also to be locked with a security door but of course did not work. Also the excutive rooms are at the other end of the hotel. The spa tub was dirty. We were on the ground floor which I had asked not to be. Outside the balcony was broken glass by what appeared to be safety glass from a balcony door. The main eating area near the lobby is where the breakfast buffet is. All I can say is don't bother. It was the most disgusting breakfast I have ever tried to have. There was no eggs left, no bacon, no hash browns. All of it was cold. The whole area was filthy, the pineapple juice was rancid and when we opted to order a nicer coffee from the bar area it took 25 minutes. The outdoor seating area was always messy as it appears no one ever services it. When you ask for an ashtray the give you these old glass candle holders or an old glass. It just seems that there is minimal staff and that no one actually maintains any area of this property or quality control. Just a very rundown hotel. I found the same thing at the Stamford Double Bay about a year ago but at least they closed that down about a month after for renovations. I really have to wonder that in this era why it is neccessary to have a giant wood tv unit that takes up most of the room just to house and little old box tv. Why not a small wall mount? Regardless I will not stay at any Stamford again as this chain does not have a high standard in my books.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - some reservations with service and food”
Reviews.Author: surfoz
Reviews.Content: We booked and stayed two nights, the room was very clean and comfortable. Check in was efficient and we were in our room in no time. There seemed to be plenty of staff however with conferences and a full house, the staff seemed to be stretched especially at breakfast. We planned to eat our meals in the restaurant however after breakfast which we thought was very ordinary, we discovered the nearby Macqaurie shopping centre which had many good eateries. We did eat one night across the road at the Ranch which was a good pub meal. The biggest problem I had initially was trying to contact the hotel directly regarding our booking. It took me at least 10 phone calls to get to speak to someone who could help me. The phones were continually diverted to the central booking number 1300 and they were unable to assist me. Generally we had an enjoyable stay and we were pleased to note that the maids were very pleasant when we encountered them in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: maryati
Reviews.Content: Love our stays. The price was expensive but considering it was a new year's eve and last minute booking, we are okay. Stayed for 4 days. The bed queen size is comfortable enough for us (me, hubby and 5 yrs old daughter, with average Malaysian size..:) Did not try the food since we are Muslim but they did have promotion of Nasi Padang at the time. Nice staff, free parking. Basically we satisfied with our stay and looking forward to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, if there are any and dirty outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: web0908
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this disgusting hotel twice now for business, not by choice, but simply because it is close to our company offices. And twice I have been disgusted by the state of the rooms and the rude staff (if there are any). This last trip will be the LAST time i ever stay at this hotel. Not only was my room filthy, but after I checked out they had the audacity to charge my room stay to my personal credit card (not my work one). I have now spent 2 days on the phone with their rude staff waiting to get a refund, with guaruntees and promises not being met by anyone that I speak to on the phone I thought I would add to the poor reviews on this forum to warn others to not even consider staying here. I want my $600 back STamford North Ryde, and no, it is not my financial instiutions fault, they have advised that they cannot see any reversal of payment from your dirty hotel, so perhaps it would be nice if someone there actually worked and fixed my issue. The rooms have paper thin walls so you can hear everything that is happening in the rest of the hotel. And I had been upgraded to a delux suite (whatever that means!) I think it is just their standard greeting (well if you are not going to come through with an actual delux room then I wouldn't bother saying it). The walls are stained with black marks all over them and the towels are old. Th shampoor/conditioner etc that you get in this hotel are gross. If you don;t have to stay here, then don't!

Reviews.Title: “Good Services”
Reviews.Author: n_anugraha
Reviews.Content: they had a delicious breakfeast, good services, and a charming receptionist :D

Reviews.Title: “Staff were great, but the hotel needs a face lift”
Reviews.Author: lucygoosey1234
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Stamford at North Ryde for many years, mainly for work (it is more a business hotel, as it is not a tourist area). I have seen a gradual decline in the actual hotel - it just looks tired. This can especially be seen in the restaurant - the food is fine, but the decor is really tired, the carpet is ripping everywhere, and the bar looks like it is from the 1990's! I have heard rumours from staff over the years that it is going to be renovated, but nothing seems to be happening. The thing that keeps me choosing it over others in the area are the staff, they are always very helpful, and nothing is too much trouble, although they always look short staffed. Disappointingly though, throughout my years staying here is the constant change of General Managers, I don't know what Stamford are doing but they certainly need to address that. The newest one seems to be doing a good job - he seems be out an mingling with the guests which is good. The gym is good, although it has quite short hours on the weekends. I have not ever used the pool, although it looks nice. Try and request a room overlooking the pool/pond. The rooms close to epping rd can get noisy when the pub over the road has parties, and the traffic noise from the rd can be a bit loud too. Business wise, the rooms are well set out, and always clean. It would be better if they had free/better priced wifi as it is very expensive at present. I will keep going back to the North Ryde Stamford, as it is a convenient location for my work, however they really need to spruce it up, or guests will start going to the newer places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Un-experienced Staff- definately not as marketed as a Luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: tanyatia
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for two nights in a Superior Suite. Our room was facing the car park. Room had a small room upon entry to the suite with a day bed, desk & wet bar. This is separate to the bedroom but not able to be closed off from the entrance room at all. Bed was hard as a rock & was not a comfortable nights sleep. However pillows were great. Ended up sleeping with a pile of them under me to avoid the springs in my back. Bathroom had a small bath with spa jets. Bathroom was rather cramped. Shower was the size of what I liked to a compare tp a coffin, really doesn't allow any bending down to get anything from the floor. This is required due to no space to put any toiletries inside the shower. Water preassure was terrible though was hot. I didn't like that the toilet is wedged in a corner that doesn't even allow room to clean yourself up. We heard water running down behind our bed head from people showering & flushing toilets upstairs. Upon check- in I was impressed with the desk staff my reservation was all ready to have me sign & they had the bags to our room before we had even parked the car. Rooms do not have a resort map or any information on what you find where in the resort. Asked at the front desk where the gym was located & was told how to get there. I was clearly dressed for the gym & went down where I found it didn't open until 9am on a saturday. The guy at the front desk didn't know this to tell me before I took the trek down there. Bar staff advised there was no snack menus & bought us the wrong order.Very unorganised service by bar & resturant staff. The lady in charge did apologise however it was all too late for this by then. I wouldn't recommend staying here if your after a luxury resort it is far from this. Business people would be ok for the price & close to macquarie university & macquarie shopping centre for shoppers. Really needs a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Weekend”
Reviews.Author: bri1975
Reviews.Content: We visited sydney in late october for a long weekend, we had an amazing time and it was made all the more special by our stay at the stamford. The staff were amazing attentive but not over the top, always smiling and polite, the food was sensational especially the seafood buffet that we had on the saturday night, great value and brilliant quality and quantity of food. The concierge were extremely helpful in helping us plan our weekend. Thankyou to everyone we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: DarrylFromSydney
Reviews.Content: We were in a Deluxe Suite booked directly from the Stamford web site. This gave the same rate as everyone else without the issues if we wanted to shorten our stay or cancel. The price was excellent for a Friday and Saturday night. We were located in room 2016, which is just near the main entrance on the same level as reception. In fact this was located in a perfect location for getting luggage in and out of the car. The room is marketed as a suite, but to be honest is missing some of the features that I would expect from a suite. The room consists of a small reception area just inside the door. This area has a large desk with Internet and one chair, one lounge chair and a coffee table. Then comes the bathroom with some drawers and a mirror in the corridor, as well as the minibar. This was followed by the bedroom on the far side of the bathroom with a view overlooking the man made pond. There was a small table with two chairs in the bedroom, making a total of four chairs of three types in the suite. There are quite a few things missing from this suite that I would have expected. The main one was door between the bedroom and the rest of the suite. This is a major issue, not because it splits the bedroom from the office area if you want to have a meeting in the room. It is more that the main door from the suite allows all the noise from the corridor in. Being a conference hotel, people often chat in the corridors, and all this comes straight into the room. On the Saturday night we were there they had a piano player in the reception area. We had no problem hearing the words the player was singing and the notes he was playing in our suite down the corridor. I would call this a major issue. Also missing from the meeting area was a second lounge chair which is common in suites from my experience, and a second TV. I looked at the door just before checking out, and it was clear that the door did not really seal. You could actually see light from the corridor come in through the sides of the door jamb. I am not sure that this door needed to be fire rated, but I would not want to be trapped in the room if there was a fire in the corridor as the smoke would billow straight into the room. The bed. Well, what can I say. It certainly did not live up to the amazing beds found in the Rydges hotels. The bed was a bit hard, but that was not what I considered the major issue. In my opinion, the bedding was far too small. In the first time ever in a hotel, by morning the sheets and blanket had not only come out from the sides but also at the bottom. It really seems like they skimped on the bedding, buying the smallest size that would cover the bed. The sheets could not even tuck in on the sides they were so small. And to top this off even the pillows were hard. The restaurant seemed nice, but they had misplaced our booking. More likely, reception who took the booking when I called did not pass it on. Still, they did fit us in. And then proceeded to inform us that it was compulsory Seafood Buffet Night. Great. Many people do not actually like seafood. On checkout I overheard another person checking out also complaining about the lack of prior indication to the guests that Saturday night was Seafood Night. He was unhappy enough to call the prices 'borderline extortion'. Thankfully when we explained about my girlfriends allergy they did offer to cook anything from the normal menu. We were grateful. Once they did take our order we did realise that this was a marketing thing only - the same items were available from the Room Service menu, albeit with a $5 surcharge. The food we did get was nice and reasonably priced, but I declined to pay $15 for desert. I am guessing that their market is for business people on expense accounts who do not flinch at paying so much. There is a nice place across the road that seems much more reasonably price.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Trnr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 times during August due to the fact it was within walking distance to work and was the cheapest at the time. 1st stay â€“ Room was quiet apart from the usual corridor noise. The bed wasnâ€™t a king size as advertised; it was 2 singles put together. The heating didnâ€™t work. The bathroom had beautiful tiles that were marked with black permanent marker, where I imagined the tissue box was going to be fixed to the wall. In the shower, the cut in the tiles were noticeably larger than the tap fitting. And insulation from the false ceiling was falling through the gaps adjoining the walls. Staff was very helpful especially when I asked how big the $12 pizza is, I was told not to bother as itâ€™s not bigger than 6 inches, but they used to be bigger! 2nd stay â€“ Was the worst. Room 3001. The room is on the second level with one side facing the main road while the entrance faced a stairwell that led down to the bar / restaurant area. I had to sleep with earplugs as on one occasion the noise (including the music) didnâ€™t let down until 1am.
