Somehow, donâ€™t ask me how, but twice all the lights in my room turned on while I was asleep. Once again the bathroom showed remnants of poor workmanship. Once again 2 single beds joined together. The iron in the room wasnâ€™t a steam iron so I purchased a spray bottle from the supermarket on the way home one night. As I knew I was returning I made a point through their customer feedback. 3rd stay â€“ Either they took notice of my feedback or it was luck. The room was down the far end of the building, still some traffic noise. The bed was a King Size. The iron was a steam iron. But then there was the bathroom... mouldy, mouldy bathroom. The metal door architrave was rusted. That couldâ€™ve been the answer to the weird smell when I walked in. If you were paying for the staff friendliness, you would be getting your monies worth. But save yourself the trouble and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting and a joke of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: drevans
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife we're in Sydney to attend a friend's wedding and we chose to stay at the Stamford because we thought being away from the city (and more or less close to the wedding reception) would be economical and provide better service with bigger rooms. We stayed in the executive suite and i was first of all shocked at how disgusting the room was prepared and secondly at how small the room was. This is the EXECUTIVE suite and it was a tiny bedroom with a joke of a kitchenette built in. There were lip stick marks on some of the glasses, dirty sheets on the bed and to top it all off you go to the bathroom and the toilet bowl was disgusting. And WORST of all, when we went to see the staff for help, the manager was insinuating that i was lying and that I had in fact dirtied the room with my wife and then when they finally caved in to cleaning the room they said that we could wait at the bar while someone cleaned our room. My wife then calmed me down, we went to the bar, had a drink (not complimentary for our trouble). Then an hour and 10 minutes later finally they tell us its ready. We go back, inspect the bathroom, it was OK, not an hour an 10 minutes type of clean but it was acceptable. Then after we get settled and we go to put the music back on (iPod docking station), we realise that our iPod is no where to be found. Before making a fool out of ourselves we checked that room up and down all over and absolutely nothing. I was furious, my wife thought it'd be better if she handled this. My wife called the manager down and then to add to this wonderful day the manager didn't believe us again and started stating that the hotel is not responsible for us losing our property and that they would in no way compensate us, etc. If the manager was a man i would of taken him outside and settled it man to man. I had enough, we packed up our things, left, gave them a piece of our mind and i have already lodged a complaint with the Department of Fair Trading and sent a letter into A Current Affair.

Reviews.Title: “Had enough and not consider returning”
Reviews.Author: anytimecheerful
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful shell - clean room, good amenties, convenient location and helpful front desk staff. However, there are always some hidden costs after you left the hotel. I used to be staying at this hotel frequently between 2007 and 2008. The last 3 times of my stay made me very unhappy because we didn't use anything from the mini-bar at all but got charged after we left the hotel. On our last stay in March, we've been charged for a bottle of red wine which we didn't consume. You may ask how can we be so sure about our memory - we can all be 100% sure because our family are non-alcoholic. We had the motto of 3 strikes out. We gave them 3 chances and they blew them all. Therefore, we choose to stay in other hotels in the same neighbourhood. If you can put up paying for what you didn't consume after you left the hotel, rooms in Stamford's new wings are quite nice. Rooms in older wing only worth 4 stars in my opinion (waring out of amenties). One time over my many stay at a room at the old wing, dead crocoach appears in the shower. Well, perhaps it also indicates they did spray the place from time to time. Otherwise, I would encounter a live crocoach instead of a dead one. Looking at others' review on this hotel, it appears I'm not the only unhappy customer. It is really a pity that such a nice hotel ruined by poor management!

Reviews.Title: “Shambolic reservations”
Reviews.Author: sagereid
Reviews.Content: Where to start. This is the third, and probably the last time I will stay in this hotel. The hotel has an unusual layout having a central reception/restaurant area with guest rooms branching off from both sides of it forming a "U" shape. This can make for a long walk to your room if you are at the end of one of these wings. The area within the "U" is taken up with water gardens and the hotel pool. The leisure club is at the bottom of the complex next to the pool. The room we stayed in was one of their suites and was very nice. Half the lights didn't work in the room and this is one of the problems with this hotel - it feels a bit run down. If you go to the pool be very careful, my daughter cut her foot on the tiles on the floor of the pool and the general state of the pool surround left a lot to be desired, with rusty bolts protruding from the concrete. Generally the staff within the hotel were very nice and the food in the restaurant was OK. The hotels revenue derives from corporate events, meeting rooms, weddings etc. with many staying guests being business travellers and Asian tour groups who come and stay for one night then leave. Breakfast staff on a few mornings were overstretched. My main gripe with the hotel is their inability to get the billing right. Before our stay we were quoted a rate for a family of 4 with breakfast. The hotel reservations failed to put this in their system meaning we were billed for all sorts, breakfasts roll up beds etc.. Trying to correct this took three attempts even though I had all the paperwork with me. The paperwork was photocopied twice by the receptionists even though most of it originated from them. Management were just as useless, sarcastic comments like "you got a very good rate then" after it was sorted, does not make for good customer service. Even telling Management about my daughters cut foot just led to the inevitable "we'll tell maintenance". No accident report, no sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely not return!!”
Reviews.Author: strawberrypatch11
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the hotel for one night while we attended a wedding. On first impressions I liked the look of the hotel in the foyer. Also we were able to check in early at 1.30pm which was great. We had trouble finding a lift to take us to our room. I went to go ask someone and before I even asked for assistance, a hotel employee asked if he could help. Not only did he take us to the lift but he escorted us to our room as well. I thought that was really nice. The room was ok. It was clean and comfortable. Nice big bed and the bathroom was clean and nice. There looked to be good facilities if you were travelling for business. The only thing i thought though is there is no way the hotel could be 4 and a half stars! It was clean and comfortable. And more convenient for business or you needed to be in the area. The room looked more 3 and a half stars if anything. Before we arrived at the hotel, we received a call from the hotel to say that the kitchen at the hotel had been in a fire and to advise us that the restaurant would be closed that night. Was nice of them to let us know. The wedding we went to held their reception at Stamford Grand North Ryde and the reception was beautiful. The staff were very helpful and due to the fire in the kitchen, the reception was delayed. Definitely no fault to the hotel. So the staff handed out free canapes and free beer and wine for the guests while we waited in the outdoor area near the pool, which were lovely. The food did go ahead at the reception and we thought the food was beautiful! Checking out of the hotel was also very quick. When we left we said we were glad we only paid a cheap rate for the room, as there is no way I would pay for full rate. Hotel was a bit old. The worst bit was when we returned home and I thought to check my bank balance and discovered that the hotel had taken out $100 as a bond out of my credit account without warning, The hotel did not say anything about paying a bond. Was very inconvenient, as I am now waiting on my $100 to refunded back into my account. This would be my main reason why I would never return to this hotel. They will try and rip you off and not tell you!

Reviews.Title: “Only because quite inexpensive and close to the offices in Pill Hill”
Reviews.Author: baol1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite outdated in all its parts: rooms, hall and common parts. Rooms are quite large but lack of any personality and the furniture will require a change. The swimming pool is good. The overall quality of the service is OK. We choose the place because in business trip and located very conveniently. Avoid the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathroom”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNewbride
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room there as we had our wedding ceremony at the Terrace . We booked the Executive Suite which was at the very back of the corridor. The room itself was clean, good size, bathroom was clean and bigger than I expected with a spa bath. There were some confusions with our booking. When we booked the hotel room we were told that breakfast was included, however it turned out that it wasnt the case. Stamford wedding coordinator also promised a bottle of wine and a box of chocolate as we had our wedding there, however the 2 items never arrived, which didnt really bother us, but better if they never suggested that. Other than these service was ok. Check in and check out was quick. The hotel itself is not close to any train station, but 10 mins away there is a big shopping centre (Macquarie shopping centre), outside there are bues which bring you to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, no value for money”
Reviews.Author: harishbala
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises rates like AUD 175 room and breakfast outside but charges more even though we had requested for corporate rates. Did not include breakfast. Rooms are ok apart from the switches for the lights in the room being near the floor, really didnt make sense. In the bathroom shower, the soap holder had some kind of mold on it. I had to put a piece of paper on it and then put the soap on it. Overall when you are shelling out so much money you expect better and at least it should include breakfast. They are just after money, would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful.”
Reviews.Author: oneword
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Grand at North Ryde is anything but grand. It is a sad, soul-less, rambling place with too few staff, most of whom seem unhappy to be there. I think if you tapped a few of the guests on the shoulder, they'd tell you they would rather be somewhere else, too! A bit of history: The Stamford North Ryde was built in the 1980s as a low-rise, large-scale 'resort' hotel. It was a dopey idea from the outset, particularly as it is located right next to one of Sydney's busiest arterial roads in a suburb dominated by low-rent housing and corporate/industrial estates. The hotel complex runs parrallel to 8-lane Epping Road and is probably half-a-kilometre in length! There are two wings with a swimming pool in the middle. Reception is at one end and then you walk, walk, walk to your room. Forget about porterage. This place runs on bare minimum staffing. Needless to say, the concept of building a 'resort' in the middle of downmarket suburbia didn't exactly blossum and the original hotel changed hands. Because it would cost so much more to operate such a spread-out property, the current operators are clearly cutting corners. One of the hinges on our front door had been replaced with an ill-fitting, flimsy hinge that looked like it would give way anytime. The holes from the original hinge were neither filled nor painted. Similarly, bathroom fittings had been replaced with cheap, mismatched tapware. Holes in the original tile work had been 'patched' by screwing power outlet 'blanks' into the wall. The telephone didn't work and we were told that nothing could be done about it. Oh, and although the room had been cleaned, it had the embedded odour of a public restroom. Other guests said their rooms also smelled like they'd been cleaned with cheap, harsh chemicals. This property is just like other Stamfords in Australia. Poorly maintained and overpriced for what's on offer. Most of the staff are 'disconnected' with a 'take-it-or-leave-it' approach to guest service. However, the Grand of North Ryde seems to go out of its way to alienate guests, even by Stamford standards. It gets away with it because of high occupancy rates generated by the numerous corporate offices located within a kilometre of the hotel. Look around the bar, dining and reception areas and you'll see many of your fellow guests have that "I'm staying here because that's where Head Office booked me" look about them. Summary: If you have a choice - any choice - go someplace else! If you must stay there, insist on a room in the wing farthest from the highway. Otherwise, you'll be kept awake by the constant traffic roar.

Reviews.Title: “Inappropriately placed”
Reviews.Author: vb527
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for 2 nights previously on our wedding night in the Executive room and thought it was a pleasant stay. Even though our room faced the main road, it was relatively quiet and lovely. Not once did we hear our neighbours or anyone coming and going. Due to this, I booked the Lazy Daze Package in the Executive room for my husband as a suprise birthday present for him to relax and unwind. Per my request hoping for an even quieter room than the room facing the main road, we were checked into the room facing the tennis court, but discovered our room had an inter-connecting door. We both thought it's a bit odd to put us in a room with an inter-connecting door. We thought nothing of it and heard no noise from next door so we didn't request a change of room. While we were getting our massages, someone checked into the room next door on the other side of the connecting door but seemed to have left soon after. Unfortunately, after a VERY pleasant in-room dinner and massage, feeling very relaxed and romantic, the people next door came back into the room and appeared to have kids with them. Kids being kids, they weren't being overtly loud but we could hear them VERY clearly. On top of that, someone directly upstairs of our room seemed to have a problem with walking (more like stomping) back and forth in their room. After 10minutes of the noise, I had enough and reluctantly rang front desk requesting if we could possibly change room knowing it was late - it's around 11pm. Reception informed they will get security to talk to these people. Even though I told them the kids next door are just being kids, we just want to change to a quieter room. They were reluctant to move us to another room. 2 phone calls later, we still were not moved. By this stage, my husband had fallen asleep so I didn't bothered calling back to change our room. Throughout the night I was kept awake by the stomping from upstairs. At 7 in the morning, I was jolted awake from LOUD scrapping & squeeking noises, as if someone was dragging a table across wooden floors. I was annoyed at the fact that I've booked a Lazy Daze package which they've promote to relax and unwind, and yet they booked a family with kids right in the next room. Not only did it got us back on edge but also totally destroyed the romantic mood the inclusive package had created. Imagine On top of that, I was shocked to find out I was not told of a charge of $100 bond when we checked in. Only to discovered when I checked my credit card statement that I got charged $515 instead the rate of $415, and this charge came through after I have paid our account in full when we checked out. After I rang up enquiring about the additional $515 charge, I was told about the bond and that this amount will be reverted back to me in 2-5 days. If not, I have to call them back to get my money back! This is definitely not the way I expected to be treated as a returning guest. After this recent stay, I'm a bit reluctant to recommend them to anyone. But inform all future bookings to request QUIET room especially if you intend to relax & unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfy”
Reviews.Author: creampie
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be clean and somewhat spacious, stayed wth my boyfriend, although we didn't order room service so I can't say how the staff were and what the service was like, but the view was very nice and you felt like you were in a resort in bali. They have cable T.V to watch at night if you feel like some T.V which was good. The bathroom was mordern and clean and there was always toilatries stocked, so you always had soap, shampoo and so on there. We found reception to be polite and nice, I can't commment on food as we didn't eat there as I mentioned before cos the menue was pricy. But Macquare shopping Centre is around the Cnr and they have many good foods to choose from and cafe's to eat your breakfast at and it's not that expensive, that is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: In-Love-With-Tahiti
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at over 100 hotels worldwide (including 3rd world countires) during the course of my lifetime and never have I received such poor service or felt so ripped off as I did at the Stamford Grand North Ryde. What you can really expect: * For your pre-ordered bottle of wine to NOT be in your room upon arrival * For your numerous requests by phone and visits to reception regarding the whereabouts of your wine to be ignored * To be charged for a bottle of wine you never receive * Cold breakfast (if delivered to your room) * Local youths hanging out in the pool and tennis court * No satellite reception for your TV What you can't expect: * Basic condiments such as salt, pepper and napkins with meals (you have to specifically request) * Prompt service * Warm breakfast (if delivered to your room) * For your order to be correct (and when you're a vegetarian the last thing you want for breakfast is ham and uncooked sausages when you ordered eggs) * For the photos they take of you to be actually sent to you * The rooms to have a view as nice as the website leads you to believe. Our room was an "Executive Suite" that overlooked the carpark and Epping Rd with no privacy at all. and It's true what is mentioned in the other reviews about most rooms being a fair hike from reception, the hotel needing an upgrade and alot of clutter in the coridoors that you have to squeeze your way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great value (if you pay the internet rates)”
Reviews.Author: MacStudent2007
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews posted here, I was somewhat apprehensive about staying at the Stamford. However, on arrival I was pleasantly surprised. Comfy room, fantastic food (albeit a little pricey), great helpful staff and beautiful surroundings, all close to the MacQuarie Uni campus with the MacQuarie shopping centre an easy walk down the road. My room was ready when I arrived at 2pm, and although it was a bit of a walk from reception I was able to park the car directly across from my room. The only time the distance became a problem was going back and forth from the dining room, however I think it may have been a bit noisy if I was close to reception. Comfortable room which was good value for the $130 internet price, however I would be hesitant about paying full price. Having the separate office part of the room was great - very handy if you are on business. Had the seafood buffet on Friday night for dinner. Great selection, but maybe not quite worth the $70-odd dollars per person. Apparently the room service option ($35 per person for a selection of seafood) was just as good. A la carte menu had a huge variety, and was in effect available 24 hours. Staff were fantastic, really helpful and friendly which was a definite change from the last hotel I stayed in while at MacQuarie Uni! Absolutely no complaints. Will definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor”
Reviews.Author: GreatBloke
Reviews.Content: As a reasonably frequent traveller to North Ryde on business I often stay at Stamford Grand. The conceirge and reservation desk are always helpful and accomodating. Room service is adequate. Dining in, the meals are quite reasonable and breakfast is the traditional smorgasbord selection, with very little innovation. The hotel is rambling and now a little tired, with renovations occurring on a continuous cycle. If you're lucky enough to get a recently refurbished room the visit is certainly more pleasant. Rooms can be upgraded to a larger room with office area, which just provides a bit more room if you've got stuff to do and some luggage items. Rooms either overlook the outdoor swimming pool and fountain / bridges, or the garden. Some rooms are a seriously long walk from the reception, so if you can't frequently make the journey, negotiate stairs and doors, request a room nearer the front. As a predominately business location there are rarely children staying. The gym is very small and over-crowded at popular times. The pool is generally quiet. Overall at this price range the hotel achives as much as you can expect, it is well located for Macquarie shopping centre, Macquarie university and the Macquarie business area. With the opening of the new Lane Cove tunnel the congested journey to the airport is better, but still takes about an hour, especially in the peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of a face lift”
Reviews.Author: BrisCaz
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here three days and it was chosen purely and simply because I was attending a conference that was being held in the hotel. I think it was relatively over-priced but it was ok - possibly needs a refurbish. The tiles in the bathroom and particuarly in the shower recess were not very nice - germophobes beware. My room was overlooking the swimming pool and I was quite happy with the space. There is a weird "office" type area as you walk in - which contains a huge desk, a chair and not much else. There is a small "corridor" area containing the mini bar and wardrobe on one side and the batchroom on the other and then you get to the bedroom. The bed was king size and quite comfortable. All in all it was ok but I have to agree with some of the reviewers with comments re the staff eg: I arrived the night before the conference and I asked the receptionist where the conference was to be held. She didnt even know anything about the conference and didnt even bother to find out - just told me to come to reception in the morning to find out. Also, when we went to the restaurant for lunch it took 4 different staff members about 15 minutes to find out where we to be seated. I possibly would stay here again if I have business in the area but more likely would stay in apartments as I prefer to cook for myself when I am away.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Hotel + Lousy Attitude”
Reviews.Author: OvationGX2
Reviews.Content: The travel agent supplied a "cut and paste" review that made me iook forward to staying in the "Premier" wing because it sounded really good. The reality............... You enter the crumbling paved driveway and unload your bags while the Bellman stands and watches looking very disinterested. Reception was OK, but then the room was at the far end of a very very long corridor, and to make it interesting there were service trolleys, room service trays, vacuum cleaners and other paraphenalia to navigate past. The corridor is narrow and so you would think the housekeepers would at least keep the trolleys hard against the wall, but no, they did not. The room was spacious and the bathroom was modern and clean, but the toilet seat would not stay raised on its own, so to be a gentleman you had to hold it up with one hand while aiming carefully with the other, The carpet was grubby and stained in various locations, the room was supposed to have robes so you could enjoy the spa bath, but it took 3 calls to housekeeping and a long wait before they arrived. The breakfast buffet was tasteless and poorly presented and we finished our plates before we could get the coffee server to come, and then I had to go ask her. The ceiling of the restaurant was seriously in need of a paint, and there were signs of water leaking around the air conditioning vents. While I blame myself for not researching this dump on Trip Advisor, I am compelled to give this place the thumbs down

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Traveller531
Reviews.Content: The service was so bad that I felt sorry for the staff. Room not ready until 3:30. Toilet not working. Food left in corridors in afternoon still there at 9;30 pm. Breakfast totally overwhelmed. Ran out of coffee, cups, saucers, milk...resorted to stirring coffee with fork...etc. Calls to reception went unanswered on two occasions. Poor management & insufficient staff. This was really poor.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cipp4
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at this hotel in september for a couple of weeks to visit family and friends as well as some sightseeing in sydney. we found the stamford plaza to be a very good hotel . the check in and check out service was quick. the concierge people quick to respond to any questions or needs. the rooms spacious and well kept. the shower and toilet area again always clean. the location is handy for the olympic stadium and macquarie university. the clientele were a mixture of tourists and business people. the hotel has a shuttle service to the local transport area in the morning and on a saturday morning at about 9.30 they have a shuttle bus which takes you into the city and drops you off at circular quay which is very handy for the opera house ,the harbour etc. They pick you up at 4.30 in the afternoon. I went on that Saturday service and found it very enjoyable. the breakfasts were good with the choice of continental or full buffet style . we had a meal at the resturaunt in the evening once with friends and they loved the prawns . the prices for the breakfast and meals are normal sydney style which is never cheap but not over the top. overall a very good stay at this hotel and would go there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Stamford Grand North Ryde
HotelInfo.Address: Corner Epping & Herring Roads, Sydney, New South Wales 2113, Australia
